text: In traditional vampire folklore, bloodsuckers have arithmomania - a compulsion to count - which is why Count von Count on Sesame Street loves numbers.
The Haitian Revolution began when Cécile Fatiman sacrificed a black pig, a ritual later repeated by Haitians resisting foreign occupation.
In 1825, the Suquamish leader Kitsap led an alliance of tribes stretching from the Columbia River to Puget Sound to stop the Cowichan slave raids wreaking havoc on the Sound.
Leon Trotsky frequented a Jewish dairy restaurant in the Bronx but refused to tip, and the waiters retaliated by spilling hot soup on him.
Hundreds of refugees at a UN humanitarian center in Niger have been protesting conditions there for more than a year.
Cūḷāmaṇi Cetiya is believed in Buddhist cosmology to enshrine both the Buddha's topknot and his right canine tooth.
The flag of Duluth, Minnesota has an award-winning simple design, but still represents eight things including Lake Superior, the North Woods, and three city hills.
Scotland's national animal is the unicorn.
A group of unicorns is called a blessing.
The Mona Lisa has no eyebrows.
The unicorn is Scotland's national animal.
The only organ that named itself is the brain.
The number 4 is considered unlucky in East Asia because it sounds like the word for 'death.'
The first animated feature film was 'El Apóstol' (Argentina, 1917).
